reviews.review_msg: MSE 422: This guy is a beast as a below-average student. All lectures recorded and his tests are very similar to what is in his lectures and study guide from the textbook. Nice guy super fair and this class was some giga nerdery levels of hard without this prof. Idk how I got such a good grade, take any class you can with the GOAT ERIK.
Very good prof. Even when he covers difficult material, he's very reasonable with his marking and the amount of work that he makes his students do.

Erik's way on explaining lecture materials was super detailed. Every little details (assumptions and etc.) must be written in the solutions. He is very lenient in grading; he doesn't care about values, but cares about the steps to get those values. Just follow his lectures and do all the homework he gives, and you should be good to go.

I think the other reviews on here for Erik are quite antiquated. Overall, very good proff. Cracks lots of good jokes, although I think I was the only one laughing at them lol.

Left the course with a strong understanding of fluid mechanics. Erik was very application oriented and I'm craving to learn more and apply the knowledge gained.

Great Prof overall and his Midterm and Homework assignments are easy as long as you do some practice questions and pay attention in class. The final however is another story. Extremely hard final. Just get the highest possible grade going into the final and just hope you pass the final which is worth 50% of the class mark.
Highly recommend Sam to everyone. He is really passionate about teaching and would go above and beyond to make sure you understand the material.
nice prof, easy to get a good grade in his class, he is willing to help you to learn

Ghasem (Sam) is a very caring professor, and he wants his students to succeed. He is an interesting combination since he is very responsive. What I mean by that is when the class fails, he tries to make you pass, and when the class does well, he tries to fail you. In the end you will likely pass though. Don't skip class, there's pop quizzes!
